image.altText: ACT Labor Senator David Smith in the Mural Hall of Parliament House, smiling and wearing glasses.

props.synopsis: Labor incumbent David Smith pulls ahead of independent candidate Jessie Price in the southern ACT seat of Bean.

title.children: Labor's David Smith takes the lead in tight race for ACT seat of Bean

image.altText: Canberra Hospial roundabout and car park

props.synopsis: Police allege the 31-year-old cleaner used Canberra Hospital's IT systems to send harassing messages and death threats to the woman.

title.children: 'I will kill you one day': Hospital cleaner charged with stalking colleague

image.altText: A Sambar deer in the bush.

props.synopsis: Keeping the ACT's deer population in check requires constant management, support and technology, including thermal-assisted aerial culling.

title.children: Feral deer are on Canberra's doorstep. Aerial culling is keeping them out of town

image.altText: glow in the dark mushrooms

props.synopsis: Glow-in-the-dark mushrooms transform parts of New South Wales into a spectacle reminiscent of the movie Avatar.

title.children: Ghost mushrooms light up forests across NSW south coast

image.altText: The ACT Supreme Court towards dusk.

props.synopsis: An elusive fraudster who has three times failed to come to Canberra from South Australia to be sentenced for theft and burglary is facing extradition, after a warrant was issued for his arrest.

title.children: Man who stole thousands from Flight Centre facing extradition to ACT

props.synopsis: After a disaster in the Nepalese Himalayas, Armando Corvini thought he might never walk again. But he's proving age and a disability cannot stop him.

title.children: How Armando found a new way to climb after frostbite took his fingers

image.altText: A non-identifiable child playing with a small Bluey toy and colourful dollhouse.

props.synopsis: More than 1,100 children may be left without daycare as the fate of centres run by the Genius childcare empire remains in limbo.

title.children: Millions in debt mounting as Genius childcare provider searches for lifeline

image.altText: A small scaly earless dragon sits on a rock.

props.synopsis: The Canberra grassland earless dragon is critically endangered and there are fears it disappear forever. Environmentalists have expressed concerns over the construction of a new road that is impacting the species' habitat.

title.children: Plan to bring Australia's 'most endangered reptile species' back from the brink

image.altText: A dog on leash walking down a hospital corridor.

props.synopsis: Dogs aren't what you'd expect to see when you step into an intensive care unit, but a study at the Canberra Hospital has found bringing therapy dogs onto the ward reduces anxiety and pain for critically ill patients.

title.children: Therapy dogs reducing pain and anxiety for intensive care patients

image.altText: A group of soldiers raise arms in air to officers standing on a tank.

props.synopsis: India and Pakistan have boosted their military capabilities since they clashed in 2019. As tensions rise between the nuclear-armed neighbours, this is how they stack up.

title.children: How India and Pakistan's military and nuclear capabilities compare

image.altText: Vladimir Putin sits in front of a microphone with papers in his hand

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin proposes direct peace talks with Ukraine to "eliminate the root causes of the conflict" after Ukraine proposed a 30-day ceasefire with the backing of NATO powers.

title.children: Putin offers direct peace talks with Ukraine after three years of war

image.altText: Australian batter Bob Cowper kneels to put on his pads.

props.synopsis: Bob Cowper, who recorded the first Test triple century in Australia, dies at the age of 84.

title.children: Australian cricket mourns death of Test triple century maker Cowper

image.altText: Jake Riccardi celebrates a goal as Mark Blicavs looks disappointed

props.synopsis: GWS finds a way to beat Geelong again, recording a gripping four-point win over the Cats at Kardinia Park. Follow live.

title.children: Giants conquer Cats again in game of the season contender

image.altText: Ryan Papenhuyzen celebrates

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers coach Benji Marshall has slammed his side after a horror 64-0 thrashing at the hands of Melbourne Storm, with Ryan Papenhuyzen scoring four tries. Later, the Sharks survived a late Sea Eagles comeback to claim a 30-14 victory at Brookvale.

title.children: Benji Marshall slams woeful Wests Tigers after Storm thrashing

image.altText: Narelda holds the reign of a horse in a forest looking at her wife Karina and baby Sanna in her arms. They are surrounded by tre

props.synopsis: Network 10 presenter Narelda Jacobs and midwife Cherisse Buzzacott open up about their experiences of motherhood — navigating joy, grief and loss, blended families, rainbow families, sleepless nights and why it takes a "ready-made village".

title.children: Narelda Jacobs on defying homophobia and becoming a mum again

image.altText: Illustration showing pieces of a puzzle with the letter W and three figures pushing puzzle pieces into place

props.synopsis: In an age of polarisation and AI, the free online encyclopedia's very existence could be at stake.

title.children: Why Trump and his allies have Wikipedia in their sights

image.altText: albanese clean energy

props.synopsis: Hydrogen is not dead, and Labor's historic victory could change the global energy trade, economist Ross Garnaut says.

title.children: Economist says Labor's victory could change global energy trade

image.altText: Aerial view of Orange in NSW.

props.synopsis: A country town famous for its food and wine is now positioning itself as an innovation and agricultural technology hub, with a growing number of entrepreneurs basing themselves there.

title.children: 'Next Canva or Atlassian': Orange is looking to realise dreams of business grandeur

image.altText: Two booking photos provided by the California Department of Corrections shows Erik Menendez, left, and Lyle Menendez.

props.synopsis: Re-sentencing hearings for Erik and Lyle Menendez, who have spent 35 years in prison for killing their parents, are set to move forward in the US next week.

title.children: Menendez brothers resentencing set for next week

image.altText: Kris Stanley sits in Hype Park wearing a black jumper and glasses.

props.synopsis: Kris Stanley, 36, went to the doctor in 2021 after experiencing suicidal thoughts every month. She left the appointment with a "liberating" diagnosis she hadn't even heard of.

title.children: After years of low moods, Kris received a 'liberating' diagnosis she'd never heard of

image.altText: Close up photo of Moran speaking into a microphone, wearing white collared shirt with dark suit jacket

props.synopsis: The Liberal candidate for Western Australia's new federal seat of Bullwinkel, Matt Moran, officially concedes defeat.

title.children: Liberal Party's Matt Moran concedes defeat in new WA seat of Bullwinkel

image.altText: A small circular spacecraft

props.synopsis: Russia's space agency says the Kosmos 482 lander has made an uncontrolled re-entry to Earth's atmosphere over the Indian Ocean.

title.children: Soviet spacecraft Kosmos 482 plunges to Earth after 53 years in orbit

image.altText: Greg Thompson stands on a paved area in front of hedges with his hands in his pockets and a sullen look on his face..

props.synopsis: When Greg Thompson became bishop of Newcastle, he refused to turn a blind eye to the decades-long child sex abuse scandals in the diocese. For him, it was personal. He was himself a sexual abuse survivor. But speaking out came at huge cost.

title.children: The Anglican bishop who took on sexual abuse in the church

image.altText: White seaspray splashing over rocks at the blowholes.

props.synopsis: Locals and tourists say they are disappointed by a plan to charge entry and camping fees at the Carnarvon blowholes in northern WA.

title.children: Visitors say new fees to access WA blowholes not 'the Aussie way'

image.altText: A field of pink everlasting daisies.

props.synopsis: A decision to plant a trial crop of the flowers 20 years ago has transformed the Egerton-Warburton family farm into a haven for creatives and curious visitors.

title.children: Thousands of everlasting daisies turn farm into social media hotspot

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair poses in a lush greenhouse surrounded by seedlings, while holding a basket of veggies.

props.synopsis: Dimity May's passion for gardening began during her maternity leave. It grew into a small business and inspired a move to regional Lutruwita/Tasmania with her young family.

title.children: How farmer Dimity May turned a hobby into a lifestyle

image.altText: Pope Leo is seen from behind praying over a grave marked "Franciscus". It's indoors and there are two white roses on the grave

props.synopsis: Pope Leo XIV speaks of the challenges posed by AI in his first official address to church leaders, before making a surprise visit to his predecessor’s grave.

title.children: Pope Leo warns of AI challenges before unexpected visit to Francis's grave

image.altText: A woman in a bright red sweater and blue jeans texts on her smartphone

props.synopsis: I may be the last person on earth to be personally confronted by the potential of AI technology. I knew it would come for our jobs. But I didn't expect it might come for our hearts.

title.children: I confided in ChatGPT like a therapist but I wasn't prepared for its response

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair surrounded by this family

props.synopsis: For the first time in a decade, Daniel Lalara has been able to express himself through song, with the help of artificial intelligence.

title.children: A degenerative disease stole Daniel's voice, now AI is bringing it back

image.altText: tight photo of vietnamese pork roll

props.synopsis: The bánh mi was created in Vietnam after the arrival of French colonialists. Now it's a firm favourite for lunch across Australia.

title.children: Why are Australians so obsessed with bánh mi?

image.altText: Australian cyclist Luke Plapp looks shocked as he falls off his bike in the Giro d'Italia.

props.synopsis: National champion Luke Plapp finishes last after a crash on the second stage of the Giro d'Italia, while Jay Vine powers through a knee injury to third.

title.children: Aussie time trial champ finishes last in Giro after coming unstuck

image.altText: A man and two teenage boys.

props.synopsis: West Australian farmer Nigel Norwood suffered a cardiac arrest while holidaying at a remote beach. His calm and quick-thinking family made sure he survived.

title.children: Nigel's heart stopped for minutes. His teen sons kept him alive

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair, wearing a purple shirt, holds a book.

props.synopsis: Once trivialised as a low-brow guilty pleasure, the romance novel is enjoying a renaissance.

title.children: Romance fiction enjoys comeback as women seek escapism
